intro: Guettarda blodgettii, commonly known as the Blodgett's guettarda, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered white flowers and opposite, elliptical leaves. It typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to saline and sandy soils. Guettarda blodgettii is of interest to botanists due to its unique ecological niche and limited distribution.
